bibl.title: Diocletian or Severus? The Enigma of Pompey's Pillar.
bibl.note: Suggests that in reality the pillar [with an inscription mentioning Diocletian: O.G.I.S. II, 718; S.B. V, 8278] is earlier than Diocletian's time and proposes to date it to the reign of the emperor Antoninus Caracalla (AD 211-217) who probably ordered to erect the column as a monument dedicated to his father Septimius Severus. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.

bibl.title: Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy.

bibl.seg: Adam Łukaszewicz, Diocletian or Severus? The Enigma of Pompey's Pillar.
Jacek Kościuk (ed.), Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy (Wrocław, 2010) pp. 223-228, 1 fig.

Suggests that in reality the pillar [with an inscription mentioning Diocletian: O.G.I.S. II, 718; S.B. V, 8278] is earlier than Diocletian's time and proposes to date it to the reign of the emperor Antoninus Caracalla (AD 211-217) who probably ordered to erect the column as a monument dedicated to his father Septimius Severus. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.
